newsitem.title: USA: FOB Gulf Grain - Corn, wheat steady, soy flat-down.
newsitem.headline: FOB Gulf Grain - Corn, wheat steady, soy flat-down.

text.p: U.S. FOB Gulf corn and wheat offers were unchanged in slow dealings Tuesday, while deferred soybean positions fell on expectations for larger supplies, exporters said.
"I understand that the farmer is still a good seller of beans," said one exporter. "That's what is pressuring the deferred positions."
All nearby values were supported by icy conditions on Midwest rivers, exporters said. Freezing temperatures have slowed traffic down considerably, traders said.
"We're just watching the river with concern," an exporter said. "Movement has been really slow."

In export news, Algeria on Tuesday bought 75,000 tonnes of French wheat and Morocco announced plans to tender for 40,000 soft wheat for delivery during the first half of February, government officials said.
SOYBEANS (No. 2 yellow, FOB, U.S. Gulf, basis CBOT, cts/bu)
-- Bid Chng Offer Chng
January unq unc +43 + H unc
February unq unc +38 + H dn 3
March 1-20 unq unc +34 + H dn 5
Note: F=CBOT January. H=CBOT March
SRW WHEAT (FOB, U.S. Gulf, basis CBOT, cts/bu) -
-- Bid Chng Offer Chng
Jan unq unc +45 + H unc
Feb unq unc +45 + H unc
March unq unc +42 + H unc
April unq unc --- + H unc
HRW WHEAT (FOB, U.S. Gulf, basis KCBT, cts/bu) -
LH Jan unq unc +68 + H unc
FH Feb unq unc +64 + H unc
LH Feb unq unc +61 + H unc
Note: H=March futures. nc=no comparison.
